moves.2... dxc4 3. e3 Bf5: Hmm, this is reminiscent of my blitz win against a 1700, shown here http://gameknot.com/annotation.pl/three-minute-plus-five-second-blitz-game?gm=50516 but in that game he didn't accept the gambit.
moves.4. Bxc4 e6: This move prevents me from playing Qb3 which forks b7 and f7 and allows his DSB out.
moves.7... c6: ?! This takes away his queen's knight's favorite square.
moves.8. Qb3 a5 9. a3: ? I was just delaying capturing on e6, but this allows him to divert my attack.
moves.9... Bxc3 10. Qxc3: Ugggh now I can't win his e pawn.
moves.10... b5 11. Bb3 Ne7 12. e4: If he captures, I can take his e pawn.
moves.13... b4 14. axb4 axb4: I miscalculated here, I thought that he couldn't recapture because it was pinned to his rook, I didn't notice that this attacks my queen. I also can't take his pawn because then he could smash my rook.
moves.17... Qxd4: And I lose a pawn. Things are looking pretty bad
moves.18. O-O: ?? I make them worse with a truly stupid blunder.
moves.18... Qxd2 19. Qa8: Well I'm not going to roll over and die, I'll put up a fight.
moves.19... Qd8 20. Re1 Ng6: ?? Allows a discovered attack that will win...A pawn...that's not really worth the trouble, so I play something else.
moves.22. Rxe5: !! If he recaptures I have mate.
moves.23. Qf7#: And checkmate. While it had a lot of mistakes, I felt it was a good combo even if it was aided by my opponent.
